Class DatasetAdaptors

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object
    Helper methods to provide different types of view on a dataset.

    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Detail

      • asList

        public static <INSTANCE> List<INSTANCE> asList(Dataset<INSTANCE> dataset)
        Create a List view of the given dataset. If the dataset is a ListDataset it is returned, otherwise this method creates a new List containing all the instances in the dataset. The list is populated by iterating through the dataset.
        Type Parameters:
        INSTANCE - The type of instances in the dataset
        Parameters:
        dataset - The dataset.
        Returns:
        a list of all instances.

      • flattenListGroupedDataset

        public static <ANN,INSTANCE> GroupedDataset<ANN,ListDataset<INSTANCE>,INSTANCE> flattenListGroupedDataset(GroupedDataset<ANN,? extends ListDataset<List<INSTANCE>>,? extends List<INSTANCE>> dataset)
        if you have a grouped dataset where the groups contains lists of feature objects (i.e. GroupedDataset>,INSTANCE>) then this will flatten those internal list, so that all the instances from those lists are directly associated with the key. This type of thing might occur if your dataset element reader can extract multiple media parts from a single dataset item, that will all end up with the same key.
        Parameters:
        dataset - The dataset
        Returns:
        The new dataset

      • getGroupedDatasetSubset

        @SafeVarargs
public static <ANN,DATASET extends Dataset<INSTANCE>,INSTANCE> GroupedDataset<ANN,DATASET,INSTANCE> getGroupedDatasetSubset(GroupedDataset<ANN,DATASET,INSTANCE> data,
                                                                                                                        ANN... groups)
        Takes a grouped dataset and returns a new dataset that contains only those groups specified. If the given groups do not exist in the provided dataset, then they will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        data - The dataset to take the groups from
        groups - The groups to take
        Returns:
        the new dataset containing only those groups.

      • getRegroupedDataset

        public static <ANN,DATASET extends ListDataset<INSTANCE>,INSTANCE> GroupedDataset<ANN,ListBackedDataset<INSTANCE>,INSTANCE> getRegroupedDataset(GroupedDataset<ANN,DATASET,INSTANCE> data,
                                                                                                                                Map<ANN,ANN[]> regroupCriteria)
        Takes a grouped dataset and returns a new dataset with the groups re-shuffled as specified in the regrouping criteria. The regrouping criteria is a map from new group name to old group name. Instances in the old group names will be mapped to the new group names. Where many old groups map to a single new group, the groups will be merged. For example: 
         
        old == GroupedDataset: {G1=[1,2,3],G2=[4,5,6],G3=[7,8,9]}

                new = getGroupedDatasetSubset( old, {A->[G1,G3],B->[G2]} )

                new == GroupedDataset: {A=[1,2,3,7,8,9],B=[4,5,6]}
        If the given groups do not exist in the provided dataset, then they will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        data - The dataset to take the groups from
        regroupCriteria - The regrouping criteria
        Returns:
        the new dataset containing the new regrouping.
